Reviews.Content: I still have an older model of this camera and have been very happy with it. The reason I am getting a new one is for my wife. She is asking for a new one, because there the usb latch broke. Now I have taken this camera on a 5 day 50 mile backpacking trip across the Northern Cascades in WA, so I don't think it was a quality issue. The camera still works fine after being rained on for 2 days and traveling in pocket while I hiked up 4000ft of mountain. The only gripe I had with the last one which seems to be a problem with this camera as well is night pictures. The camera can never seem to take good pictures in the dark, don't know if the flash isn't powerful enough or what, but night pictures never seem to come out very well, no matter what setting you use. I love the zoom; best zoom in any pocket camera that I have ever seen. Daytime pictures are awesome. The feel and use of the camera are great. The menus are easy to use, the controls; everything. This newer version feels a lot lighter then the last one I owned. Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who wants to take great pictures in daylight or outdoors where you need a zoom.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I wanted the black body w/it's sleek look.  It is a little heavier than my previous point n shoot but it is well worth it to have the options it gives you.  The price was great for what was given.  I took it out of the box, didn't have time to read anything and took pics at our Christmas party.  They came out pretty good for not knowing anything about the camera and it was dark in the room but the quality was better than my other camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tstanley79
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a trip to Disney World. My wife took the majority of the pictures in auto mode and they turned out great. Other members of our family have a much more expensive camera and, in my opinion, ours turned out better. The different modes are easy to switch too as well. In many places a flash could not be used, but the picture still turned out great in the night time mode. We would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Still testing
Reviews.Author: traveler
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the 16x feature which I am happy with.So far the macro is disappointing. I'm hoping it improves when I get used to the camera. It is not as easy to work with as I had hoped.  As a result I leave it on automatic most of the time. I have not taken a lot of pics in low light but the ones I have came out better than expected.

Reviews.Title: THIS LITTLE CAMERA IS AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Nancy J. Mcdaniel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I previously had a Nikon coolpix P90, which I absolutely hated!  I wanted something that would take good pictures inside and out, and take a nice video.  I picked the perfect camera for that!!  I used the video first, and it is incredible!!  I do use a  SanDisk 8GB Extreme SDHC Class 10 High Performance Memory Card, which I would recommend if taking videos with this camera.  I love the size of this camera, and it would fit in your pocket or purse. It's very user friendly, and easy to navigate with the menu button.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a point and shoot camera that takes great pictures and is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: A good Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Gail Lee Mac
Reviews.Content: I have a significant amount of Nikon Pro level equipment and do some commercial photography. I wanted a P&S; that was around $200 that could be used as a travel camera.I have not used any of the scene modes, but the Intelligence mode and the aperture and shutter modes work extremely well.  The zoom and stabilization work very well. Mostly importantly for me, the images are incredibly sharp. This is a camera you need to speed sometime with unless you want to only use the Intelligence mode - but remember this is a 25mm-300mm (35mm eqiv.) zoom and it can take advantage of all of the power built into this little camera.It is not a substitute for a $3000 DSLR and f2.8 zoom, but it will take very good images if you spend some time learning all of its features. I'm  picky about my images (website: [...])Upto 13 x 19" printed images look good. There are lots of choices now in travel zooms, the ZS5 is a good one at a fair price point.This camera is good enough that getting photoshop elements (less than $100) will let you really learn photography.Because of the small sensor the limited f stop range is not a real problem when it comes to depth of field. F6.3 on a camera this size is like f11 or so on a DSLR.The Intelligence zoom gives you 16X and it is very hard to tell from the 12x optical - looking at 100% resolution at the pixel level.Given that this camera has a "super zoom" and lots of settings besides the Intelligence or program mode, I rate it very highly. With so many ways to configure this camera, the only problem I see is taking the time to use it to learn it before you head off to Europe or Africa, or on vacation here in the US.

Reviews.Title: 12 zoom sweet
Reviews.Author: rick
Reviews.Content: Nice cameraIt is shirt pocketable. A little heavy but easy fit and heavey is good for holding.Saturation is a little weak.Software is somewhere between poor and unusable. Pictures do not display properly.25-300 is fun. Very versitile. Maybe too many selections to set up quickly.MY PET PEEVE: Every camera needs an optical viewfinder. When one uses reading glasses it doesn't matter how big or good a digital screen is, it's not possible to see the scene and the screen.Recommend this camera although a bezel adjustment like some of the new cameras would be nice but they are under 5X which is a no go.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5
Reviews.Author: Rdurof "Mister D."
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for, long zoom for birding/wildlife, yet compact enough to fit (barely) in pocket.  Only thing I don't care for is Panasonic software - a lot more complicated/squirrely than the Canon software I was used to.  So I am using Picasa 3 instead for taking pictures off camera and into my laptop and that works just fine.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: A. T. Smith "ATS In Maine"
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these. I Dropped em, worked em hard, Gave one away and had one stolen Keep one on me at all times. Good at micro & macro enough said...

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: dominick prodoti
Reviews.Content: really like this camera.Easy to use,reliable and nice and small,great!!Has a lot of features that I would never have thought to use but they are cool to use and I am not a camera nut.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: rhm
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with great angle lens for its size. We take pics of apartments and condos and it can come to terms with most every sized room.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I've ever had!
Reviews.Author: Gregory Lowell Kiser
Reviews.Content: I had one of these previously and used it for 4 years and damaged the SD card slot. It was going to cost over $200 to fix (I had gotten it for a little over $350 at the time), so I looked here. I found it for around $90.00 refurbished and it's just as amazing as my first. The description had said it had minute scratches (I had to search for them.)  This camera has every feature you could want and is like a DSLR in more convenient form. With everything from a manual, sports, and high speed function to an underwater one, I could not be happier with me freedom with it. It takes photos just as well, if not better at times, than my Canon Rebel XS. It's awesome and I'd highly recommend it for good high quality photos and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Everything is good except the picture quality
Reviews.Author: Gyorgy
Reviews.Content: It has a good feature set, HD video, good display etc. But the picture quality is bad. I had a ZS1 (I was happy with that one) and I have decided to upgrade due to the additional features. And I am disappointed. The pictures have much more noise than pictures took with the old camera. Even in small size the difference is obvious. I do not recommend this camera. (I used to have other cameras, I also have a DSLR, I know how to set a camera. The picture quality problems are not coming from the wrong settings.)

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: David J Fischer
Reviews.Content: The lense and zoom are amazing you cant go wrong.  Highly recommended, very easy to use takes great picturesthanks

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera but it didn't last very long ---- Not the camera fault though . I went into the ocean with it in my swim trunks pocket to my dissapointment . SO I ordered another on , this time getting the next one up on the scale I got the DMC-ZS8 . Its good but I really miss the ZS5 , I was just getting used to it .

Reviews.Title: i really liked this camera a lot
Reviews.Author: laurencg
Reviews.Content: but it broke after a few months.  the lens projects/retracts when it turns on and off, and i guess the motor died.  one day it stopped focusing, and then the lens would no longer move, and then there was an error message on the display.  (i don't remember exactly what it said now.)  i just so happened to be in another country when this happened so it did this at one of the worst possible times too.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image...
Reviews.Author: EBIEV
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, fits in pocket easily. Awesome zoom. Computer program that comes with it makes storing pictures a pleasure. Would definitely buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix from Big Value Inc.
Reviews.Author: RDB
Reviews.Content: I had reservations when ordering this Used Like New item.I previously owned this exact camera.The package arrived quickly, there was no way to determine that this item was not brand new. All functions are like new, the photos come out with great clarity as do the videos.I highly recommend this camera and vendor and am very pleased with my purchase.Richard

Reviews.Title: Versatile Small Camera
Reviews.Author: John M. Sparks
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera, it gives me the Zoom range I like because,  we do a lot of Museum, Gardens, and Zoos visiting. With the Zoom range I can go from a Close-up Flower, to a Bird up on a tree. The only problem I have with it is, when the sun is behind me, this wipes out the viewing window. I hear a hood for viewing is available for the back which allows holding up to your eye. The only thing I can recommend as a caution is if you think most of your use is outside, then consider a Camera with both options. john

Reviews.Title: Great , Best go to Camera!
Reviews.Author: ron Kreml
Reviews.Content: After almost two years since I have made this camera My third leg it has never let me down.  I have found it to be good in low light to a degree that hand held braced works great.  This little well constructed photo tool has been to the beaches of Kauai to the shores off Block Island,RI and ZS5 has made a great camera to just grab and pop a shoot without loading up the big canon....and the results are very sharp compared to others of this class that I have tried.  I am going to recommend this to my daughter with her first child on the way and for developing an eye for composition.  I know its strange but this Lumix is a friend needing a name.

Reviews.Title: Lumix zs5
Reviews.Author: up north in michigan
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera 14 months ago to replace an Olympus. Noticed a couple months ago that there were squiggly lines in the picture when using the zoom. Researched the problem and found there is dust on the lenses. Notified Panasonic and was told it could be replaced with a refurbished camera for an additional fee of $192.00. Will be looking for another camera but not a Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Worth the $
Reviews.Author: Peter Subosits "p subs"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on the best travel zooms, and this one consistently performed well in lab tests done by magazines and websites. I bought it for around $215 and I am very glad I did. It's easier to say what this camera does poorly than what it does well, so I'll point out some of its weaknesses that I noticed. In indoor settings with no flash, it does pretty badly if your subject isn't still or you are without a tripod. The flash is decent...A little bright at times for me, but editing on Picnik/Photoshop can easily fix that. This camera produces excellent scenery shots, but I think its strongest point is the macro shots. Just put the camera in macro mode and it will produce professional looking shots. There is a manual mode but the Program Aperture mode is so good that I hardly ever use it, it really is like a much more expensive camera the way it captures sharp details of flowers/food while blurring the background. The battery life is very good. And lastly, I enjoy fun photo effects so the "High Dynamic" and "Film Grain" scene modes are favorites of mine! Basically, if you are looking for a great travel zoom, this one is hard to beat. It's a bit chunky but can fit in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: I don't know too much about photography but this camera is great. I've had lots of comments on pictures I took on a recent trip to Ireland, that the pictures look professional. They're surprised the pictures weren't taken with a really expensive 35mm. I dont use all the different settings (havent had time to figure it out). There is a trip feature that you put the dates of your trip, and title it. Then when your home it will sort the pictures by days on the trip. Great camera, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: This is a fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty experienced photographer and this is my fourth P&S.; It is by far the best P&S; camera I have ever owned. Unlike other cameras I have owned, the many options this one has actually improve the picture quality instead of make things more difficult and artificial looking. I love the macro, three presets are nice, the feature allowing me to reduce the file size and gain more optical zoom power is awesome, and the battery lasts just as long as advertised. One thing I have missed on my other P&Ss; is Nikon's "best shot selector" feature. But here I can use exposure braketing, get three quick takes, and then pick the best one of the three when I'm at the computer. It works just fine. I find that the image stabilization works quite well, though nobody should ever expect I.S. to reduce blur when zooming beyond 8X. On any camera, including this one, be prepared to use a tripod or some other form of physical stabilization for the higher zooms. Some people have complained about the Intelligent Auto feature, but I find it surprisingly accurate. It's the first camera I've owned that can actually tell automatically when you want to take a macro shot.Since this isn't your simple P&S; camera, be prepared to read the instructions and keep going back to them as you try out all the options. There's so many good ones that you'll enjoy every opportunity to try a new one out. One drawback is that the instructions don't have an alphabetical index, just a detailed table of contents in the front, so you sometimes have to search for the feature you are researching. The "find" menu on Adobe helps a lot. Panasonic blew it on the included image handling software, which I find useful only for reading the properties of photos so I know what settings I used. And even then it doesn't have a complete list of the ZS5's features.I guess to summarize, there's four rules to good photography: 1. Be there. 2. Have a good camera with you. 3. Know how to use it. 4. Use it. This camera fills the bill on #2. The rest is up to you, but with the ZS5's nice size, good quality, and great features, you have no excuses.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1S4I9QX6LKP2J', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1S4I9QX6LKP2JloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1S4I9QX6LKP2JcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1S4I9QX6LKP2JcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:24 MinsThis camera takes excellent pictures, even without fussing with all the manual settings. But there are a lot of manual settings to fuss with if that's your thing. I like a combination of both. The O.I.S. is amazing. I practiced taking pictures while my hand was in motion, and some came out blurry (I was moving my hand fairly fast) but some came out perfect (when I slowed my hand speed but was still moving). You could take pictures while walking and you'd probably never know you weren't standing still. Even the best camera will give you a blurry picture if you're moving too fast, but I was very impressed that you could move at all and still get an amazing picture. I was able to take videos up to 8 minutes long, which I appreciated. I thought the quality was good, both picture and sound. Another thing I appreciated was the zoom. Other cameras I have used gave me very grainy pictures when using the zoom, even only to 2x, but this camera I can zoom all the way to 12x and still get an amazing picture. I haven't really tried extending into the digital zoom range much, only a little, and it still seemed pretty good comparatively. I like the size and feel, and it seems to be well built. There are a lot of pretty great things about this camera and I am very happy with the purchase.In short, what I love most about this camera is:- Great O.I.S.- Quality zoom- Video length- Size (I have small hands, and this fits well without being too small)- Sleek feel- Feels like quality materialsAbout the video I included, it is just a short video I took while at Iguaçu Falls in Brazil, it isn't me talking about the camera. It was overcast and I was standing in a shadowy area, and the video still came out pretty good in my opinion. The falls are extremely loud, and the camera video sounds just like it did when I was there, except not as loud! You can see a butterfly flying in front of the camera a couple times in the beginning. (Sorry I turned the camera sideways in the middle.) Just a side note, this is only a very small portion of the falls. No picture or video will ever do it justice! Even the professional panoramic shots. It is one of the 7 natural wonders of the world.

Reviews.Title: Second time around
Reviews.Author: bonsangue66
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, lots of fun and takes beautiful pictures. I bought it again, my first (older model) fell in the water. This camera is not water proof.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Still Shots
Reviews.Author: Kihea
Reviews.Content: I really love the Panasonic Lumix Cameras.  This one has lots of features, including utilizing JPEG format for older computers, instead of SDXC format for Windows 7 and above. The movies taken inside aren't as smooth and clear as my older DMC TZ7, but nevertheless, acceptable.  I also take lots of outdoor shots and love the 12x feature. In general it's an easy camera to use.  The hand-hold part is a bit difficult to deal with, but I'm getting used to it.This camera is a real find for me.

Reviews.Title: First digital camera
Reviews.Author: gwalsh
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera.  My daughter brought one and she highly recommended the camera. I am higly pleased with all aspects of the camera.  My husband who is a tech phobia loves this camera.  Might have to buy another just so he and I do not fight over who is taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Excellent Resolution, Better ZOOOOM!
Reviews.Author: Alkamir
Reviews.Content: This camera by fair away, beats any Sony Cybershot series W. , the zoom its excellent, and the image quality its very good even on low light conditions. i would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS5
Reviews.Author: organizer957
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice fit for me because of its ease of use and nice picture quality.  I like the mechanism for the 12x zoom.  So far, I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good, but low light is an issue
Reviews.Author: Alexander Quinn
Reviews.Content: Given how far the sensors have come along, I was hoping this camera would do better in low light.  That part was disappointing.  Also, it uses an oddball plug, so now I have *THREE* different micro/mini USB cables around my computer.  Why couldn't they just use the normal mini-USB?  However, the buttons feel nice, better than the Canon I had before.  The camera feels sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Barry N. Wilensky
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Nikon point and shoot. After reading lots of reviews all over the web and understanding that model change time was coming, I decided that this camera was an excellent choice.  Great price, very good speed of writing, and excellent optics.  I use it in my school classroom, and it will join my Canon Rebel T2i this summer on vacation.  I don't really know which camera I will use more.  This one is pretty good for standard size pics.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value, super manual capability
Reviews.Author: JTM
Reviews.Content: As a relative newbie in photography I am  enjoying the full range of zoom and the auto/manual capabilites of this camera...Being the first camera I have owned in over 20 years, I find this to offer one of the best values in small camera arena...

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: kevin dwyer
Reviews.Content: The Pamasonic is outstanding. I have a Nikon D300 and the Panasonic takes almost the same quality picture. The lens is sharp and the equivalent of a 25mm-300mm lens.Really top quality.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: R. Fuchs
Reviews.Content: I have had a lot of point and shoot cameras and this one really fits the bill for me.  There are lots of preset options, plus you have options to focus it on your own, which is rare to find in a point and shoot.  It's a bit bulky, but still fits in my pocket so I can take it everywhere I go with my two sons.  If you are looking for a good point and shoot that gives you a bit more control and a decent photo, this might be the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: You will not be disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Mike Robinson
Reviews.Content: I got this to go on vacation in Hawaii. After major disappointment with previous camera purchases, It is nice to finally find a product that I have no complaints about!

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS5
Reviews.Author: Rheath
Reviews.Content: I've been a DSLR user for seven years, but after a recent vacation was interested in something more compact. I began researching the category of travel zoom cameras and found several good candidates. I wanted the flexibility of manual settings, a long zoom, good macro focus, and good low light response. This seems to be a great combination of all those. The solid feel of the camera puts me in mind of some of the classic 35mm range finders I used decades ago. It's all I wanted and I'm still exploring more its features. I'll still use my DSLR, but won't have to lug it around on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Handy size, good distance
Reviews.Author: Jan Hurst "artist and calligrapher"
Reviews.Content: Pretty good camera for the price, and though I love the long distance I can get with the zoom, I miss the low-light capabilities of my old Fuji.  Also, it is slow to re-set for the next photo...not so hot for pix of active grandbaby.  For general use, however, I have to love the Leica lens.  The output is great, the size is small enough to pack with me every day - which I do - and it is great for taking pix both for my art pursuits and of my finished work.  See my blog to see great snaps of the aforementioned grandbaby [...], and some of my work at [...].

Reviews.Title: versatile camera
Reviews.Author: sea tern
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera, which I have had for a month.  On a recent flight I used "aerial".  The pictures are really terrific, zoomed. In time I will experiment with shutter and aperture priority as I have not done that yet. The only complaint I have is that when I grab it with my right hand and take a snapshot, my hand pushes buttons that I do not want pushed.  Have to use 2 hands to avoid that problem.

Reviews.Title: Totally satisfied
Reviews.Author: Juancentro
Reviews.Content: The best camera I ever had, period.Very good auto mode, and simple scene modes to fit difficult pictures

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Casey C. Alvey "Casey Alvey"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband and he loves it.  It has a great zoom and is very small and easy to travel with.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS5
Reviews.Author: James Haddon
Reviews.Content: First off we are discussing a point shoot camera, not a even a 'high end" point & shoot, given that, this is an e x c e l l e n t camera. Fits in your pocket, albeit a tad bulky, it still easy to carry. The lack of color noise in contrasty situstions is above average, and the user inter face is a breeze to use. I have other point & shoot cameras, and I never strayed from the Canon line up because of the ease of use.After purchasing the Lumix, I have to say that optics are very impressive and can hold their own against my Canon G-12. For comparison sake, I also have a Nikon D200, that becomes 'work' when taking happy snaps because of the bulk. I am very happy with this Lumix and would recomend it anyone looking for a little point & shoot with great optics, decent sensor abilities, and ease of use. It also a well made piece to boot.Having had this camera, and used it for a week or two now, I will look at other Lumix products. It has had that much of a positive impression on me!

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you are most interested in good pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Cowing "I like dangerous toys...fun!"
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera guru...I play with Photoshop Elements, not the full Photoshop Suite, so I consider myself and enthusiast.  I think it is important that you understand this so that you can know where I am coming from.This camera generally takes great pictures...I have had a couple instances where I needed a quick photo in a very high contrast area where it has failed me (an indoor shot with a sliding glass door and snow outside...didn't have time to play with settings to figure out how to get it to take a decent picture).  For point and shoots I have always bought Canons, but I really didn't like the reviews I read on the comparable Canon so I took a chance on this camera.  I also own a Sony DSLR, again want to outline my frame of reference.  I prefer my DSLR as it gives me more options, but honestly, a camera that isn't with you isn't going to get the shot, and I can't carry a DSLR around everywhere with me.  I took the DMC-ZS5 on vacation to Reno/Tahoe and I have to say it really impressed me.  It took great pictures (I will try to attach a couple).  The camera did an incredible job with snow.  My only complaint about it are the controls and menus.  I wish it had a dedicated video button to start recording a video, and the menu system, while not overly complex works differently than my previous Canons and my DSLR.  I am getting used to it, but it still seems a bit counter-intuitive.  It also does not have some of the cute functions that some others in it's class have (smile or wink sensor to trip the shutter is the one that I can think of but I remember others when I was researching). The HD video (720P) is acceptable, but it is not going to replace your camcorder as it isn't that good and you are limited to 8 minute and 30 second clips.In summary, if you want an affordable picture with a big zoom that takes great pictures, and can live without some of the newest features and video isn't a major deal for you this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: LumixZS5
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD. 12 Megapixels and 12X zoom are a good combination to give great pictures at any distance. Most of my limited use of the product was over the Christmas season so lots of great portrait style photos. All in all very pleased .

Reviews.Title: Best for the $
Reviews.Author: JPmexico
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for 5 month now.  Excellent!  This has the flexibility with many manual controls, great shots and some nice features.  I'm not going in-depth for this review but I hounded the web prior to purchasing and still am a happy camper!  Expecting many years of point and shoot use and easy traveling.  Dial down most of the shots to 5 or 8 MP to conserve space; 12MP if I really want to edit the work later.Basically, if you want some nice features, don't crave GPS, need a flexible camera for all the occasions to easily slip into a bag or even a pocket... I doubt you'll find a better option for the money!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS5 is Best Point & Shoot for the Money
Reviews.Author: Cap'n G
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic DMC-ZS5 with 12x optical zoom to replace my Sony 4x optical zoom camera when its shutter would no longer open.  I looked at quite a few cameras and the Panasonic was the highest rated point-and-shoot camera even close to the 229.99 sale price I paid. For those who want a simple point-and-shoot camera this one is awesome!  The "Intelligent Auto" has taken excellent pictures right out of the box with no fussing.  The photos are MUCH better quality than I had on my Sony camera (I've take over 200 photos so for with the Panasonic).  Also, the camera is solidly built and it just feels like you are holding a quality piece of electronics when you hold it.  A similarly priced Nikon felt cheap by comparison.  If you are looking for a point-and-shoot for under $300, GET THIS ONE!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Hackler "TheHack"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I like the automatic settings and the ease of setting your own exposures and f-stop.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Tina from Brooklyn "Piedmont photobug"
Reviews.Content: I love the pics from this camera - clear and crisp.  Feels just right in my small hands, not too small but still compact enough for a solid feel, esp, with the slight front 'bump'.  Zoom has no trouble focusing but the macro takes a bit of time to get focused.  Optical zoom provides good images; digital zoom not good at all.  Some features I will never use but the quality of images is why I bought the camera and the Leica lens is just fantastic.  I'm still annoyed that Panasonic only provides a small manual and DVD - I bought a manual on line to really learn all the camera's features.  Otherwise great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Wall
Reviews.Content: This is really my second camera.  Loved the first one.  Pictures and everything was great.  With my first took it to the beach where it ended up getting a little sand on the lens and that lead it to start having problems with the auto focus and zoom then it stopped working all together.  Because I really loved the camera I decided to try another (this time avoiding the sand) and so far it has not disappointed me in the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: A good value
Reviews.Author: Scap
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic ZS5 may be the best in its class.  Some of the features are not intuitive, so you may have to consult the owner's manual a few times, but once you figure it out, it's not too bad.  The only real downside I have experienced is it does not perform well in low light.  But overall, it's a very nice camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-zs5 is close to perfect.
Reviews.Author: judith secher
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS5 is a great camera. Zero complaints. It is inexpensive, perfect weight, size, and ease of use. Most important, it produces sharply detailed photo images. Much improvement over Canon cameras I used in the past. Long battery life for rechargeable battery. Prior cameras ate up AA batteries quickly.Caveat: a little tricky to order a backup battery on the Internet. Need to be careful to buy the EXACT battery made by Panasonic for this exact model only, and definitely not one of the less expensive ones, none of which are exactly the same as the Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS5
Reviews.Author: doug welsh
Reviews.Content: Seems to offer lots of features plus quality.i usually don't take much time reading manuals--so i have been able to do the basic stuff and am pleased so far.when i want to figure out how to do something that's not obvious, then it's a bit difficult to quickly find and understand how to accomplish what i'm looking to do.would i buy it again? absolutely. a great feature/price point.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera that does it all!
Reviews.Author: carolyn "carolyn"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and it's so intuitively designed, I was able to quickly discover its amazing ability to do everything from a wide screen format to a giant zoom to tight closeups - all from a small pocket size device. It works well in low light, easy to disable/enable flash, change settings, move into different modes, etc. Given the camera's size, the picture quality is also far better than I expected. Easy to download files from the card or the usb cable. The movie mode creates very high quality files. I will no longer be lugging around large cameras and lenses!

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: martianmisfit
Reviews.Content: got it as a present for the wife and she loves it. camera works great and it was actually cheaper on amazon than at retail.

Reviews.Title: Warning: Screen scratches easily!
Reviews.Author: Michael Indgin
Reviews.Content: While I own this camera and love the quality, versatility and bells and whistles, you have to protect the viewing screen. It scratches if you look at it wrong. Be sure the first thing you do with this or any camera with a screen is protect it somehow.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - UNRELIABLE Panasonic replacement battery quality; POOR Panasonic customer support
Reviews.Author: RK
Reviews.Content: First, the positive: Bought the camera (Panasonic Lumix DMZ-ZS5) in April 2010. After a year of using the camera, I still find it to be a great super-light "pocket" camera with an excellent feature-set (super-wide angle lens, optical image stabilization, intelligent resolution, large variety of auto-exposure settings, and manual exposure control). Several previous reviewers have done a great job explaining these features, so I won't repeat them here. I consider myself an advanced user, and I like to experiment with several exposures for each composition (whether using this point-n-shoot, or my SLR) - so I always like to travel with (at least) a couple of spare, fully-charged batteries. The battery that came with the camera seems to work as advertised (~300 pictures) and I am still happy with its performance. So, I am upgrading my rating by one star (consider this as 5-stars for the camera, but 2-stars for the battery system & 1-star for Panasonic customer support).Now, the negative (or, why 3 stars?): Based on warnings from other reviewers (both here and elsewhere), I decided to buy two brand-new Panasonic replacement batteries (from the Amazon marketplace). Before purchasing, I checked that these were IDENTICAL to the one that came in the original box (PANASONIC DMW-BCG10pp). I paid over 75% of their list price - so, I did not go for the cheapest batteries out there. After the batteries arrived, I checked that both came individually wrapped in (seemingly) genuine Panasonic cardboard/plastic packaging. Both had identical markings their sides, as compared to the original that came with the camera. However, owing to work/travel commitments, I did not get a chance to test out these new batteries for over 3.5 months. Just recently, I took the batteries out of their packaging, charged them, and tried to use them. But the ZS5 refuses to recognize the battery, shutting down within 3-4 seconds with the message: "This battery cannot be used". I waited several hours, recharged the batteries, and tried again - with the same result. I looked online and found that this message results from ID-secure feature built into their cameras to identify non-Panasonic battery packs. I then tried Panasonic's support web-site, but found nothing related to either battery problems or firmware updates for the ZS5/ZS7.So, I called Panasonic's customer/tech support (U.S.), hoping for some sort of a firmware download or some other "re-setting" procedure that would let me over-ride the camera error-message. To my surprise (and after three phone-transfers), instead of helping me figure out why TWO, BRAND NEW, Panasonic batteries were being rejected by their own camera, the rep kept insisting that I bought the battery over 90-days ago, so they cannot help me! Now perhaps I am naive, but I consider a battery to be brand new (within a reasonable time-limit, of course), as long as it has not been abused or used before - so it should not matter whether I bought the batteries 90 days vs. 110 days previously (at the time I called them). They could not even tell me if there are ways to identify a genuine "PANASONIC" battery pack!During our extensive online review prior to buying this camera, the battery issue never come up. But now when I type the exact camera-error message in Google, I get several hits on this subject (all pertaining to Panasonic Lumix cameras). I was stuck abroad with only a single working battery, and TWO BRAND-NEW batteries that didn't work! I eventually found a Panasonic vendor in the country I was living in and bought another 'genuine' Panasonic replacement battery for higher than the list price - this new battery pack seems to be working well so far.So, I wanted to put this warning out there that in spite of Panasonic's advertised "stringent" standards that purportedly make their batteries so much better, their camera's failure tolerance seems to be so tight that many of their own batteries fall outside of it! I find it frustrating that there is no way to tell which of the "PANASONIC" branded batteries are really genuine until you pop them into the camera - even if you pay attention to details, or fork-out close to the list-price. So, the lessons learnt for me are: (1) Don't expect that the "Panasonic" brand implies a guarantee of quality or reasonable customer/technical support; (2) If you plan to buy any Panasonic Lumix camera, or any of their new ID-secured battery based cameras, check online for 'battery cannot be used' or 'battery failure' for that camera before purchasing; (3) Be prepared to go through the hassle of trying out several replacement batteries, EVEN if you buy Panasonic's own; and (4) Thoroughly test out any spare replacement batteries you buy within the first 90 days (I guess the last one's a "DUH!").I have never bought a camera outside of Canon before, and will most likely go back to Canon after this - I am afraid I cannot trust Panasonic to "do the right thing" at this point.Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Panasonic doesn't respond to customer needs
Reviews.Author: rachyilicous
Reviews.Content: I bought a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5..within three months the camera broke.  I returned it to Panasonic, paid for the shipping, and got a replacement camera.  The camera broke this time in less than 2 months in the exact same way as the first camera.  It was obviously a poorly manufactured product.  Yet despite my best efforts, Panasonic would  not issue a refund and I was stuck with a broken replacement $200 camera.  Panasonic had terrible customer service.  I was happy with the camera when it was working and it took quality pictures, but a broken camera doesn't do me any good.  I was terribly disappointed with Panasonic and will really think twice about purchasing a Panasonic product in the future.

Reviews.Title: NEVER buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Ellie K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 6 months ago. within that time i have had to get a replacement 3 times. And as of today (6 months after buying it) I have to return it again. It keeps getting an odd black dot in all the pictures. There is nothing on the lens or inside. It just continually has this weird black dot show up. I will never buy this camera again. If you want a great camera dont buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Good solid camera for every day use
Reviews.Author: faeryfriendz
Reviews.Content: I love the quality of the pictures and it is very easy to upload pics to the pc... the only con is that the electronic zoom is very difficult to control.  It seems to be an "all or nothing" zoom... still working on understanding that.

Reviews.Title: great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Irvin
Reviews.Content: bought this to replace our old point-n-shoot.  only had for about a week, and love it.  there are a ton of settings, and scene options.  the zoom is amazing.  great picture quality.  gave it 4 stars because of price, i paid $210 in Aug 2010, and  I'm sure the price will continue to drop.  You more than likely will need read the manual, as i need to do, to fully understand how to use all the different settings and scene modes.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Curley Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had very good reviews.  The picture quality is pretty good when there is a lot of light, but in low-light conditions there is a lot of noise in the images.  Just zoom in to any dark portion of an image and you'll see what I mean.Also, I don't know why they use the proprietary QuickTime format for video instead of standard MPEG.  QuickTime eats up too much space, and most programs can't deal with it properly.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic camera with flaws and high learning curve
Reviews.Author: Jennifer German
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is Not a 12x optical zoom or 16x zoom camera.  It's zoom is 16x from the camera's starting point, which is not normal 1x vision.  Meaning: when you look at something with your own eyes, and then look at it through the camera, that object is further away looking through the camera.  Which allows the camera to take a wider field of view picture.  But 2x optical zoom on the camera gives the same distance as if you are looking at the object without the camera.  Which means 16x zoom is actually only 8x true zoom.  And it's not even all optical!  That was my biggest issue, as I was looking for a super-zoom camera and was disappointed to find out this truly isn't one.Secondly, this camera has a High learning curve.  Repeat: HIGH learning curve.  Annoyingly so.  The camera takes amazing pictures whenever the settings are correct for the situation.  The problem is no one setting is correct for even just all the most common situations, and what you want to photograph can change on you fast.  And the instruction book that comes with it has NO information on the dozens of different pictures modes and options.  (I haven't checked the digital PDF document on the CD to see if there's a real instruction manual on there.)  Here's just the stuff I remember right now of what I've found: - The intelligent auto feature works well outdoors in normal light, but very not well other times. - The "A" mode works indoors in normal light, but not low, and in sunlight. - Portrait works in indoor bright light and outdoor shade or other low light. - Baby 1 works best for high action, like dancing and sports. - Self-portrait is the only mode that maintains the self-timer setting you choose between pictures. - To get a fast recovery speed between picture taking you need to turn off image review. - Oh, and more than half the time you'll want to set the flash to force off to get true colors! - Etc, etc.Last negative in my opinion is that the door that covers the battery and SD card and is held closed by a latch is very flimsy.  I fully expect that's gonna be the first thing to break.On the plus side:- the video this camera takes is excellent quality.  I was surprised at how much detail and how fine the resolution.  Just keep in mind the camera can't light for a video, so it won't work in darker situations.  But get a large SD card so you can take longer length videos!- "MS" mode (which is My Scene) is handy because you can customize a scene and save it under MS for later use quickly.- the navigation controls on the back of the camera are easy to learn and well placed for fingers.- fits in a purse easy, and normal pockets too- the panorama assist is very cool!Overall, the camera is too flexible without giving help on how to make it work best, but when you come across the right settings it does fantastic stuff.

Reviews.Title: Decent point and shoot, horrendous customer service
Reviews.Author: mamber-m
Reviews.Content: It's not mainly about the camera, which is decent but no DSLR. I purchased this camera since it offers a lot of manual controls, but you don't use the control much anyway if the quality is average. You do the manual control because the picture quality is good. I hoped I can use this unit like my DSRs, but at the end I didn't. At the end, I use it like any other point and shoots that I own, so having more options than the average P&S; does not matter at the end. And I guess this is the biggest sales point of the camera.Image quality, weight, durability... all qualifications are average compared with other respectable manufacturers like Canon, Nikon, Fuji, or even Sony/Minolta (no American or Korean manufacturers included). Nothing stands out (positively or negatively) compared with other $200-300 P&S; cameras. I purchased because Panasonic P&Ss; usually get a good review at Digital Camera Review and I didn't hate the other Panasonic P&Ss; that I own, but it's hard to see any difference from my Canon P&Ss; in terms of image quality.What stood out is the amazingly bad customer service of Panasonic. So... my camera stopped working, which happens unfortunately. It is within the warranty period so Panasonic agreed to exchange (not to a new unit, possibly factory refurbished one. Cheap...). i shipped back my unit to the service center, and I got delivery confirmation. But basically the service center lost the unit (or they say they cannot locate the unit). I managed to talk to a person at the service center after a couple of emails and a couple of not-returned phone calls, and she promised to search and call me back in a day or two. But nothing happened after a couple of weeks. Actually 3 months passed since my camera was delivered to the service center. I sent several follow up calls or emails, but no response. I guess I have to give up.I think the camera is decent, but not much better to accept the horrible service. Basically, if you buy a unit, consider that there is a risk that there is no warranty implemented. Considering the service, and the average quality, I would never buy a Panasonic again. and I recommend you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: David P. Werlich
Reviews.Content: My third Lumix camera and the best  one yet.  Has a wide range of manual settings and the Intelligent Auto feature for fine results without much effort.

Reviews.Title: small controls
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Just got a panasonic DMC-ZS5 and right off the bat the feeling was no good and all the controls were TOO close.Took a pic with it and it seemed ok,But the body is just too small for my hands,May be good for a girl.So i'll be looking for a slr with a view finder.Then atleast you have the feel of a camera not a toy. I dose have a wide lens 25mm,thats another reason i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera- except for the quality of the pictures...
Reviews.Author: G. Furciniti
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after scouring the internet for a quality point and shoot camera.  I am trying to take nice pictures of a fast moving toddler, and thought this was the answer.  I'm a not a photography buff, so I was looking for a camera that I can set on automatic and snap away.  I was very disappointed when I downloaded the first set of pictures.  Many of my Christmas morning pics were blurry- a problem I never had with my old canon sd800.  My primary reason for looking to upgrade was a snappier response rate and quicker flash recharge, both of which seemed to about the same as my old camera unfortunately.  I was happy with the construction and feel of the camera, but was underwhelmed with the image quality on the automatic setting, and I don't have the know how or patience to play with the custom settings.  So, I'm returning it, and I'm stepping up to the Canon SD95.  Yes a bit more expensive, but the kids are only little once.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for amateur usage
Reviews.Author: Robert Edward Ahrens
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use occasionally at events and parties, basically amateur usage.  It does exactly what it should.  The quality is great, when uploading to the computer it is clear even zoomed in.  The video is also good quality, although there is no light available for video use, so only use it in well lite areas.  Can't complain about it.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Digial "Point and Shoot" Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul B.
Reviews.Content: Great camera, particularly the zoom capabilities.  And I do like the rechargeable battery design (versus the AA format found with many cameras in this class).  I do wish there were more printed instructions on using the camera -- since it seems to have far more capabilities than I am accustomed to.  But unfortunately, it does not come with an instructions manual -- other than the "fast start" type.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic, where is my camera?
Reviews.Author: Jessica Vosburgh "kvos"
Reviews.Content: Good list of features. Lacking manual focus which this camera should have. Great Zoom. I took several good pictures before the camera broke. The video quality is good as well. When the camera worked, I was happy with it and could stand to deal with the other issues, but now I wish I never had strayed from Canon.PROBLEMS!!!1. The lens broke 3 weeks into owning the product. 2 weeks of lost time while camera was with Panasonic Exchange Center. VERY FRUSTRATING!!2. I had to fiddle around with the settings quit a bit to get the image quality to be good. A lot of the automatic settings produce very poor pictures.3. The way the camera save images on the SD card (file storage format) is poor. You cannot create folders. All files are stored in one AND ONLY one folder.4. Due to the file storage format, you are essentially required to use their software to download the images if you want them in separate folders based on day of image capture.6-10-10 UPDATE: Panasonic sent me a refurbished unit in place of my broken ZS5 unit. I was frustrated and asked to get a new unit, not a refurbished one. They said that was not their policy and they have done all they need to do for me.My Advice:1. Camera takes decent pictures, but not great.2. Panasonic Customer service/policy is not good.3. Buy a different brand (based on my experience)

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Allan Hawkins V
Reviews.Content: Great camera, powerfull zoom, but as all my Panasonic cameras, I got a dust particle inside the lens, How??? I really don`t know but seems to be very common with Panasonic.After a few months using this camera, lens get more dust inside. Poor seals inside.Forget the IA mode, totally frustating.7/09/2011HOW you jump from $214 to $339? Make NO sense!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: M. Owen "Maureen"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a compact camera that had a lot of options.  This one does it!

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS5 LCD Screen
Reviews.Author: PSLB "stlouber"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera but it is difficult to see properly the LCD screen when you are taking photos in the sun. Zoom and video are excellents.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS5 Not Acceptable
Reviews.Author: Larry F. Crowell
Reviews.Content: Pros: Wide angle lens, Great zoom, Compact sizeCons: iAuto is iDumb, Features Don't Work, Very Bad Flash PerformanceMy Uses: Live Music Videos, Live Music Pics, PortraitsUse: I take pics of live music acts, especially in large venues and small clubs, so I want a compact camera with long zoom, wide angle, and good low light performance.Present camera: Canon A720is, 8MP, 6x zoom, 35mm equivalent lens, 2.8, 1600ISOThe specs on this Panasonic DMC-ZS5 are so promising, and the performance is so disappointing.There are two KILLER REASONS that I have rated this camera Not Acceptable.1. The flash performance is totally unacceptable. About 1 out of 10 pics come out exceedingly blue tinted. Take a look at the pics in this link. Two consecutive shots within the same minute, same camera settings, stage lighting did NOT change.[...]The tinted pics can be approximately corrected in software with -15% blue and +15% red, if one was willing to do that. I'm not.2. I could not get any of the advertised "Focus Lock" features to work. I tried AF Tracking and both Continuous AF modes. No matter what I tried, when I pressed the shutter button, the camera still went through the Auto-Focus process. The AF-Assist lamp even came on. Panasonic claims a 0.005 second shutter lag with these "Focus Lock" modes; not achievable.I have 21 OTHER REASONS why this camera is not a good choice. Here's just a few. If anybody wants to know more of them, I'll be glad to post.3. For what I do, the iAuto mode is essentially useless. All of the indoor live music shots that I tried came out blurred. The reason being that iAuto decided that they were "Night Portraits" and shot them at 1/8 second or so.4. Almost all of my pics were coming out too dark. I had to continually use EV of +1 or +2.5. The slow speed of the 2-speed zoom is essentially useless. The zoom lever is way too touchy to access the slow speed.6. The software PhotoFunStudio quit working. "Cannot continue the operation because the folder or file is being registered." I didn't bother to try re-installing it.7. The Hi-Sensitivity Mode (ISO6400) is pretty much useless. I was shooting Av mode at 1600ISO and getting a shutter speed of 1/20, which was kinda slow. So, I switched to Hi-Sensitivity and guess what, I got the same ISO and shutter speed, except at reduced resolution. Why bother?8. The Quick Menu is incomplete. Still have to use the main menu for some settings, like turning Intelligent-ISO on/off. Having two menus just confuses the issue. Looks like two menus were designed by two different groups of people who didn't talk with each other.9. In iAuto I took a night flash portrait @ Tv=1/8 Av=3.3 ISO=400 Size=2560x1920. Why wasn't the size 4000x3000, like I asked for?10. I sent messages to Panasonic, via their web site, about #1 and #2. No response after 7 days. And, the message text block on their site doesn't allow enough characters to explain problem, nor will it accept attachments.11. - 23. Contact me if you really want to know. Reasons 1. through 10. should be enough to scare you away.

Reviews.Title: Not a Simple Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Tracy Rogowski
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Disney, since I felt the camera I had did not take Great pictures. I read countless reviews and narrowed it down to this Lumix and a Cannon 1400s. I felt the Lumix would be a smarter choice since the optic zoom was greater. During my trip, I felt like I was constantly "monkeying around" with the settings...and missing shots . Fortunately, my brother and his family were on the trip with us and he is sharing his pictures with me. Also the AI (intelligent automatic) setting did not take great pictures. I realize I need a simple point and shoot that takes great pictures, so I will be trying the Cannon next. If anyone has any better suggestions for me I would appreciate them.

Reviews.Title: Dont think BUY
Reviews.Author: Efem Esi
Reviews.Content: Really doesnt need to many words. Do the research, this camera is the best in this price range. Dont worry about the lack of 100s of reviews on amazon. More buy more review.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS5 Camera
Reviews.Author: Hartmut Voelker
Reviews.Content: The Camera was a grat purchase and takes great clear photos it also very easy to use.I would recomend this camera without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Awful customer service
Reviews.Author: Jelf
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer and wanted something small to carry around for informal family shots.  I chose this camera for it's quality and balance of features after researching extensively.  The camera is nice, but not intuitive for someone new to Panasonic.  I need to go to the manual often for small adjustments and feature instructions (I still reference my DSLR manual after several years for rarely used functions). UNFORTUNATELY no printed manual comes with the camera!  There is a little start-up guide that is nothing more than how to charge the battery and turn on the camera, but the manual is only included as a .pdf file on a disk.  Now, the reason I bought a point-and-shoot was to use it when I wasn't home so I didn't have to lug my DSLR around.  I could print the manual - all 90 pages - and carry it in a folder with me... but really?  So I called customer service and discovered that you can order one for the low price of $23.69 plus $5 s/h!  When pressed for the reason a fairly expensive point-and-shoot doesn't come with a real manual, I was given the response that it is only for "advanced" features.  I gave them a hard time and eventually was re-directed to a manager who said the most they could do was waive the shipping and he advised me to print my own.  When I explained I didn't want to carry a file-folder around and wanted a compact manual (honestly!), he said that the $24 dollar one was printed the same size (8.5"x11").  I asked if he saw the absurdity of this situation and he agreed but could do no more.  Although the camera appears to be a quality little machine, I am extremely disappointed with the customer service.

Reviews.Title: Poor indoor image quality
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I returned this because the indoor image quality wasn't good enough (In sunlight the pictures are excellent).  Instead I bought the Canon SX130IS.  It is a lot better, but not ground breaking either.

Reviews.Title: Horrible display image
Reviews.Author: Wop36
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this camera. It had a horrible LCD display and the video it took was terrible quality. With all the great sub compact cameras out there I would strongly reccomend finding another one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: R. Glaza "rtred"
Reviews.Content: Unless you are a serious photographer this camera is a waste!!  Automatic settings create lousy pictures.  Very complicated to figure out.  have not yet figured out how to make corrections so the colors come out closer to what they should be.  Bought this because of the reviews and features, but the truth is in the pictures and they are lousy!!

ProductInfo.Features:
The DMC-ZS5 features a powerful 12x optical zoom lens (35mm camera equivalent: 25-300mm)
The 25mm ultra wide-angle lens has about twice the shooting area as a standard 35mm lens
The Intelligent Zoom with the DMC-ZS5  extends the zoom ratio by approx. 1.3x maintaining the picture quality even combining a digital zoom
The Sonic Speed AF system in the DMC-ZS5 has a maximum speed of approx. 0.35 second (wide-end) / 0.41 second (tele-end) for auto focusing
The POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) nearly doubles the hand-shake correction power of conventional MEGA O.I.S
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
